messages.content: AniTalker-ComfyUI is a custom node for ComfyUI that integrates the AniTalker tool, which is used for generating animations based on a given text or audio input.
Which GitHub repository is AniTalker-ComfyUI based on?
AniTalker-ComfyUI is based on the AniTalker repository, which can be found at https://github.com/X-LANCE/AniTalker.
What are the tested system requirements for AniTalker-ComfyUI?
AniTalker-ComfyUI has been tested on Python 3.10, with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti 11GB graphics card and PyTorch version 2.3.0+cu121.
What commands should be used to install AniTalker-ComfyUI in the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory?

To install AniTalker-ComfyUI in the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory, use the following commands: git clone https://github.com/AIFSH/AniTalker-ComfyUI.git, cd AniTalker-ComfyUI, and pip install -r requirements.txt.
Is there a tutorial available for AniTalker-ComfyUI?
Currently, there is no tutorial available for AniTalker-ComfyUI, but it is mentioned as 'todo' in the documentation, indicating that a tutorial may be added in the future.
